name: Islands Around the World Quiz for Experts | Physical Geography

questions.text: Which of the following islands is not one of the three largest in the Mediterranean?
questions.explanation:
Crete.

	While Cyprus is an independent country, Sicily and Sardinia are both part of Italy, while Crete belongs to the nation of Greece.  Crete is the fifth largest island in the Mediterranean after the three islands above and Corsica.

questions.text: What is the largest entirely Indonesian island?
questions.explanation:
Sumatra.

	Borneo and New Guinea are larger, but both shared with other countries.

questions.text: What is the largest island of Japan?
questions.explanation:
Honshu.

	Tokyo and Osaka are both located on Honshu, by far the most populated Japanese island.

questions.text: What is the largest island of the Philippines?
questions.explanation:
Luzon.

	On Luzon can be found the capital of the Philippines, Manila.  The U.S. naval base called Clark Naval Base was once to be found on Luzon as well (as is Mt. Pinatubo).

questions.text: What is the largest Canadian island?
questions.explanation:
Baffin.

	Baffin Island is across the Davis Strait from the largest island in the world, Greenland.

questions.text: What is the largest freshwater island in the world?
questions.explanation:
Manitoulin & Manitoulin Island.

	Manitoulin Island is in Lake Huron in Canada.  Manitoulin is large enough to have several of its own lakes, including Manitou Lake.

questions.text: Which Scottish island can be reached by crossing from the mainland town of Kyle of Lochalsh?
questions.explanation:
Skye.

	Across the strait from Kyle of Lochalsh is the town of Kyleakin.  Skye is a member of the Hebrides Islands.

questions.text: According to most geographers, is Australia an island?
questions.explanation:
no.

	Australia is not considered an island, but rather a continent.  Another example is Antarctica, which is a rather small continent, and not considered an island.

questions.text: Cheju is a resort island of what country?
questions.explanation:
Korea.

	The Koreans call it Chejudo ('do' meaning 'island').  It is the tail on the Korean bunny rabbit.

questions.text: What is the largest Russian island?
questions.explanation:
Sakhalin.

	Sakhalin is just off the Pacific coast of Russia, and north of the Kuril Islands.   Thank you for taking this quiz, I hope you enjoyed it and will try my other quizzes in this genre.
